Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Allow if conflict with package from same owner" (#10163) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/5583

My [previous PR](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/commit/ca170345892cddb68c83be446c39e2b138190660), I inadvertently made typosquatting check too strict, this change would allow if they're from same owners by keeping both original and normalized values in cache. It would add few mb memory, but not big deal, main concern was CPU time previously.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Repair Item] Fix unicode character on nuspec." (#10157) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes
* Adds a new validation to verify `nuspec` file is normalized.
* Updated .gitignore to accept nupkgs from the TestData folder.
* This validation is the same that is done on `db2catalog` job that was not performed on Gallery previously.

# Screenshots
### Invalid unicode error in nuspec file
![NuGet Gallery invalid unicode error](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9e8f6d54-0998-419c-87e4-876904bb89c6)

### Non Form C normalized nuspec
![NuGet Gallery non normalized nuspec warning](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1bed6c80-c4ba-48d9-87e9-079619073f97)

# Addresses
https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/5470

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "An item with the same key has already been added restoring in Visual Studio when two projects have the same name" (#13745) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

VS17.11

### Worked before?

yes, maybe 17.10, maybe 17.8

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

see: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Cannot-nuget-restore-after-updating-visu/10696231#T-N10714249-N10730661

Two projects in two "solution folders" have the same name: Test
Visual Studio's error list has the error: "Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: An item with the same key has already been added"

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigation telemetry for Owner Profile URLs in PM UI" (#13738) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Enable the navigation telemetry so we can track usage of the Owner Profile URL feature on the PM UI Packages List and the Details Pane.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Collect telemetry for HTTPS sources with HTTP resources" (#13744) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Collect telemetry for HTTPS sources with HTTP resources in their service index

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add msbuild extension point after Directory.Packages.props is imported" (#13743) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Define an msbuild extension point to be able to import msbuild logic directly after the Directory.Packages.props file gets imported.

This mimics the extension point that already exists for Directory.Packages.props: https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/07a6d0d9cd3515987587b34dd8171c5c7372dcd9/src/Tasks/Microsoft.Common.props#L36

This is useful as source-build updates the Version metadata on the PackageVersion items to lift dependencies to a live built version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Epic] Support for credential providers deployed via .NET tools" (#13742) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
* [ ] (NuGet discovers credentials providers installed using .NET tools)[https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/13740]
* [ ] (NuGet executes credentials providers installed using .NET tools)[https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/13741]

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet executes credentials providers installed using .NET tools" (#13741) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: When `HttpHandlerResourceV3Provider` needs to authenticate, if the credential provider was installed using .NET tool command, use the discovered provider to authenticate the user.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet discovers credentials providers installed using .NET tools" (#13740) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow and make sure NuGet discovers credential providers installed using .NET tools. 
`dotnet tool install <provider package name> --global` should install the tool and add its path to the `PATH` environmental varibale. Iterate through all the paths in `PATH` and all the files in the path to find the plugins. By design, we expect these plugins to be named `nuget-plugin*`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Document source-only packages" (#13739) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I couldn't find any official documentation on source level packages (source only packages?) What are they even called officially?

The best I found was:
 * https://andrewlock.net/creating-source-only-nuget-packages/
 * https://medium.com/@attilah/source-code-only-nuget-packages-8f34a8fb4738

We also need some guidelines on naming (how to always name them? Package.Name.Source?)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Navigation telemetry for Owner Profile URLs in PM UI" (#13738) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Enable the navigation telemetry so we can track usage of the Owner Profile URL feature on the PM UI Packages List and the Details Pane.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
